update.description:
This pull request adds the ability to connect Gazebo with multiple Ignition Fuel servers and list the models available in each sensor. 

It's not possible to download models yet, only listing them.

~~It requires [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/pull-requests/24) from Ignition Fuel Tools.~~

I've made the dependency on Ignition Fuel Tools optional for not disrupting CI until we have a released version ready.

![gazebo_fuel_list.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/838125610-gazebo_fuel_list.png)
update.title: Ignition Fuel support - model list

content.raw: That's true. I'd like to add that this is an optional dependency for now, so we have to be careful using `Ignition Common`.  I'd prefer not to add the explicit dependency because for now we're not using it. We could add it in the first pull request that directly uses some `Ignition Common` functionality. Hopefully at that point we'll have different components available for `Ignition Common` and we won't have to install all its current dependencies.
content.html: That's true. I'd like to add that this is an optional dependency for now, so we have to be careful using Ignition Common. I'd prefer not to add the explicit dependency because for now we're not using it. We could add it in the first pull request that directly uses some Ignition Common functionality. Hopefully at that point we'll have different components available for Ignition Common and we won't have to install all its current dependencies.

content.raw: Following up on this just for completeness, `ign-fuel-tools` currently only uses `Console.hh`, `Filesystem.hh` and `Util.hh` from `ign-common`.
content.html: Following up on this just for completeness, ign-fuel-tools currently only uses Console.hh, Filesystem.hh and Util.hh from ign-common.

content.raw: Just checking, was this inserted after `gazebo_models` on purpose? Looking at pull request #2800, it looks like Fuel will be given precedence, so maybe move it above?
content.html: Just checking, was this inserted after gazebo_models on purpose? Looking at pull request #2800, it looks like Fuel will be given precedence, so maybe move it above?

This pull request adds the ability to connect Gazebo with multiple Ignition Fuel servers and list the models available in each sensor.

content.raw:
I'll just point out in case people hadn't noticed this before, but this will introduce into Gazebo 9 an indirect dependency on ign-common0.

Maybe we can consider adding an explicit dependency on ign-common and start using its features, such as filesystem.
content.html:
I'll just point out in case people hadn't noticed this before, but this will introduce into Gazebo 9 an indirect dependency on ign-common0.

Maybe we can consider adding an explicit dependency on ign-common and start using its features, such as filesystem.

content.html:
It should be fixed in 0fcac00.

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/326/

content.raw:
I added a test file in 0fcac00. I'm testing that:

 * Nothing really bad happens when the server is incorrect or down.
 * That I received similar data in a similar way using a mock class. Note that this is not using the real `FuelModelDatabase` functionality, so it's questionable its utility. I'm open for suggestions if anyone has more ideas.
content.html:
I added a test file in 0fcac00. I'm testing that:

  • Nothing really bad happens when the server is incorrect or down.
  • That I received similar data in a similar way using a mock class. Note that this is not using the real FuelModelDatabase functionality, so it's questionable its utility. I'm open for suggestions if anyone has more ideas.

content.raw:
The real requests over the network. I see two main problems:

1. If the server is down the test fails.
2. All Gazebo instances in the world will test against our Fuel server. Not entire sure if that's a good idea (even if we're doing it right now).
content.html:
The real requests over the network. I see two main problems:

  1. If the server is down the test fails.
  2. All Gazebo instances in the world will test against our Fuel server. Not entire sure if that's a good idea (even if we're doing it right now).

content.raw:
there is a compiler warning about unused variable `_server` on the CI jobs that don't have ignition fuel tools

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/323/warnings21Result/

there is a compiler warning about unused variable _server on the CI jobs that don't have ignition fuel tools

content.raw: I'm not sure what you mean. Is the dependency the problem or the "real requests over the network" the problem? Our current model database test fails when gazebosim.org/models is down, so it wouldn't be that different

content.raw: Ok I see. So is the plan to get configuration files in before Gazebo 9?

content.raw: `api.ignitionfuel.org` should be the right server when we are production-ready. But in any case, this won't be hardcoded here when we have support for configuration files in Ignition Fuel Tools. We still need to implement it.
